document.masterDocTitle: The cicadas (Hemiptera: Cicadidae) of Bolivia including the descriptions of fifteen new species, the resurrection of one genus and two species, seven new combinations, six new synonymies, and twenty-eight new records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The cicadas (Hemiptera: Cicadidae) of Bolivia including the descriptions of fifteen new species, the resurrection of one genus and two species, seven new combinations, six new synonymies, and twenty-eight new records

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Proarna albida var. insignis
Distant 1881a: 12
. ( Nicaragua )

subSubSection.paragraph:
REMARKS. This species can be variable in size (body lengths 20–24 mm ). Small specimens approach
P. alalonga
and
P. strigicollis
but the wings are proportionately shorter. Body coloration is also variable from green to brown marked with piceous forming a well camouflaged animal in its natural habitat. There is often a longitudinal piceous or dark brown mark on the dorsal head and prothorax. The fore wings exhibit the full complement of infuscation marks found in the genus. The species has been associated with grasses in the cloud forests from the lower levels of the Yungas floristic province in Argentina (
Sanborn et al . 1995a
; 2011a). The species is endothermic (
Sanborn et al . 1995a
) to permit activity without access to solar radiation.
